intro: Psidium aerugineum, commonly known as the green guava, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually a glossy green. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, and it produces small, green fruits that are edible. The botanical features of Psidium aerugineum make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
